text: The four AWS support plans are basic, developer, business, and enterprise.
AWS Trusted Advisor is an online resource that helps you reduce cost as well as increase performance and improve security.
Elastic Transcoder allows you to produce media files that are optimized and well suited for various device types.
Storage Gateway is a hybrid storage service and allows your on-premises data store to interact with S3.
Redshift is AWS’s managed service for OLAP and business intelligence.
Glacier is Amazon’s long-term data archival solution.
CloudTrail is the AWS service for logging and is particularly helpful for auditing and compliance.
CloudWatch provides monitoring of applications and is a low-cost solution for AWS monitoring.
IAM is the best option for handling users, groups, and permissions within AWS.
Both SWF and SQS deliver a message at least once, but only SWF guarantees that a message will only be delivered a single time.
'A' records are used to point a specific domain or subdomain to an IP address.
A policy is AWS’s document type for describing a set of permissions.
RDS supports a number of database options: MariaDB, Aurora, PostgreSQL, MySQL, Oracle, and SQL Server.
The default settings for CloudWatch specify a 5-minute interval at which metrics are collected.
Route 53 has a number of valid routing policies: simple, failover, geolocation, geoproximity, latency-based, multivalue answer, and weighted.
All of the S3 storage classes offer 11 9s of durability (99.999999999%).
AWS Fargate is a serverless compute engine for containers that works with both Amazon Elastic Container Service (ECS) and Amazon Elastic Kubernetes Service (EKS).
Amazon Lightsail is a virtual private server (VPS) and is the easiest way to get started with AWS to build and host their applications in the cloud.
Elastic Load Balancing supports three types of load balancers: Classic, Application, and Network.
Amazon ElastiCache is a web service that makes it easy to deploy and run Memcached or Redis protocol-compliant server nodes in the cloud.
By default, you can create 100 buckets in a single AWS account.
EC2 instances as well as ECS containers can both be scaled up and down by Auto Scaling.
IAM policy documents are written in JSON.
There are four types of policies in IAM: identity-based, resource-based, organization SCPs, and access control lists (ACLs).
CloudFront automatically provides AWS Shield (standard) to protect from DDoS, and it also can integrate with AWS WAF and AWS Shield advanced.
AWS accounts allow you five elastic IP addresses per region by default.
Amazon RDS backups can be retained for up to 35 days.
All metadata for EC2 instances is available at http://169.254.169.254/latest/meta-data.
A VPC can only have a single internet gateway.
Security groups evaluate all the rules on the group before deciding how to handle traffic.
Security groups only provide for 'Allow' rules. All other traffic is automatically denied, so allow rules are the only means of allowing traffic in.
Both a NAT instance and a NAT gateway provide for outgoing traffic to route to the Internet from instances within a private subnet.
NACLs are stateless — rules must exist for inbound and outbound traffic. Security groups are stateful — anything allowed in is allowed back out automatically.
A SWF domain is a collection of related workflows.

Weighted policies route among multiple resources by percentage. Failover incorporates backup resources for higher availability. Latency selects the available resource with the lowest latency. Geolocation tailors request responses to the end user's location.
Identity pools provide temporary access to defined AWS services to your application users. Sign-up and sign-in is managed through Cognito user pools.
An Internet gateway performs NAT for instances that have a public IP address.
Credential delivery to databases or third-party applications is provided by AWS Secrets Manager.
